Parameter.Name: Free text
Parameter.Whatis: Free text is copied into the Equation-block of the SIF as such.
Parameter.StatusTip: Free text is copied into the Equation-block of the SIF as such.

Parameter.Name: Reluctivity
Parameter.Whatis: Give the reluctivitity (inverse of permeability).

Parameter.Name: Relative Permeability
Parameter.Whatis: Give the relative permeability compared to vacuum.

Parameter.Name: Relative Permittivity
Parameter.Whatis: Give the relative permittivity compared to vacuum.

Parameter.Name: Electric Conductivity
Parameter.Whatis: Give the electric conductivity.

Parameter.Name: Magnetization 1
Parameter.Whatis: Give the magnetization in x-direction.

Parameter.Name: Magnetization 2
Parameter.Whatis: Give the magnetization in y-direction.

Parameter.Name: Magnetization 3
Parameter.Whatis: Give the magnetization in z-direction.

Parameter.Name: H-B Curve
Parameter.Whatis: Give the H-B Curve as a cubic spline.

Parameter.Name: Cubic spline for H-B curve
Parameter.Whatis: Should a cubic spline be applied to the H-B curve.

Parameter.Name: Current Density 1
Parameter.Whatis: Give the current density in x-direction.

Parameter.Name: Current Density 2
Parameter.Whatis: Give the current density in y-direction.

Parameter.Name: Current Density 3
Parameter.Whatis: Give the current density in z-direction.

Parameter.Name: Electric Potential
Parameter.Whatis: Give the externally defined electric potential.

Parameter.Name: AV
Parameter.Whatis: Give the initial condition for the scalar potential.

Parameter.Name: AV {e}
Parameter.Whatis: Give the initial condition for the vector potential.

Parameter.Name: Fix Input Current Density
Parameter.Whatis: Fix the given input current to be divergence free.

Parameter.Name: Use Tree Gauge
Parameter.Whatis: Use tree gauge to eliminate redundant lines in the linear system.

Parameter.Name: AV
Parameter.Whatis: Give the scalar potential value for this boundary.

Parameter.Name: AV {e}
Parameter.Whatis: Give the vector potential value for this boundary.

Parameter.Name: AV {e} 1
Parameter.Whatis: Give the x-component of the vector potential value for this boundary.

Parameter.Name: AV {e} 2
Parameter.Whatis: Give the y-component of the vector potential value for this boundary.

Parameter.Name: AV {e} 3
Parameter.Whatis: Give the z-component of the vector potential value for this boundary.

Parameter.Name: Jfix
Parameter.Whatis: Set the value of the potential field used to make the current divergence free.

Parameter.Name: Dirichlet conditions via magnetic flux density
Magnetic Flux Density 1
Parameter.Whatis: Give the x-component of the desired magnetic flux density.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Flux Density 2
Parameter.Whatis: Give the y-component of the desired magnetic flux density.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Flux Density 3
Parameter.Whatis: Give the z-component of the desired magnetic flux density.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Flux Density {n}
Parameter.Whatis: Give the nodal component of the desired magnetic flux density.

Parameter.Name: Electric Current Density
Parameter.Whatis: Give the electric current density for this boundary.

Parameter.Name: Current Density
Parameter.Whatis: Give the current density for this boundary.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Strength 1
Parameter.Whatis: Give the x-component of the desired magnetic field value for this boundary.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Strength 2
Parameter.Whatis: Give the y-component of the desired magnetic field value for this boundary.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Strength 3
Parameter.Whatis: Give the z-component of the desired magnetic field value for this boundary.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Transfer Coefficient
Parameter.Whatis: Give the magnetic transfer coefficient value for this boundary.

Parameter.Name: Electric Transfer Coefficient
Parameter.Whatis: Give the electric transfer coefficient value for this boundary.

Parameter.Name: Free text
Parameter.Whatis: Free text is copied into the Equation-block of the SIF as such.

Parameter.Name: Reluctivity
Parameter.Whatis: Give the real reluctivitity (inverse of permeability).

Parameter.Name: Reluctivity Im
Parameter.Whatis: Give the imaginary reluctivitity (inverse of permeability).

Parameter.Name: Relative Permeability
Parameter.Whatis: Give the relative permeability compared to vacuum (if not reluctivity given).

Parameter.Name: Electric Conductivity
Parameter.Whatis: Give the real electric conductivity.

Parameter.Name: Electric Conductivity Im
Parameter.Whatis: Give the imaginary electric conductivity.

Parameter.Name: Magnetization 1
Parameter.Whatis: Give the real magnetization in x-direction.

Parameter.Name: Magnetization 2
Parameter.Whatis: Give the real magnetization in y-direction.

Parameter.Name: Magnetization 3
Parameter.Whatis: Give the real magnetization in z-direction.

Parameter.Name: Magnetization Im 1
Parameter.Whatis: Give the imaginary magnetization in x-direction.

Parameter.Name: Magnetization Im 2
Parameter.Whatis: Give the imaginary magnetization in y-direction.

Parameter.Name: Magnetization Im 3
Parameter.Whatis: Give the imaginary magnetization in z-direction.

Parameter.Name: H-B Curve
Parameter.Whatis: Give the H-B Curve as a cubic spline.

Parameter.Name: Cubic spline for H-B curve
Parameter.Whatis: Should a cubic spline be applied to the H-B curve.

Parameter.Name: Current Density 1
Parameter.Whatis: Give the real current density in x-direction.

Parameter.Name: Current Density 2
Parameter.Whatis: Give the real current density in y-direction.

Parameter.Name: Current Density 3
Parameter.Whatis: Give the real current density in z-direction.

Parameter.Name: Current Density Im 1
Parameter.Whatis: Give the imaginary current density in x-direction.

Parameter.Name: Current Density Im 2
Parameter.Whatis: Give the imaginary current density in y-direction.

Parameter.Name: Current Density Im 3
Parameter.Whatis: Give the imaginary current density in z-direction.

Parameter.Name: Electric Potential
Parameter.Whatis: Give the real externally defined electric potential.

Parameter.Name: Electric Potential Im
Parameter.Whatis: Give the imaginary externally defined electric potential.

Parameter.Name: AV Re
Parameter.Whatis: Give the initial condition for the real scalar potential.

Parameter.Name: AV Im
Parameter.Whatis: Give the initial condition for the imaginary scalar potential.

Parameter.Name: AV Re {e}
Parameter.Whatis: Give the initial condition for the real vector potential.

Parameter.Name: AV Im {e}
Parameter.Whatis: Give the initial condition for the imaginary vector potential.

Parameter.Name: Fix Input Current Density
Parameter.Whatis: Fix the given input current to be divergence free.

Parameter.Name: Use Tree Gauge
Parameter.Whatis: Use tree gauge to eliminate redundant lines in the linear system.

Parameter.Name: AV re
Parameter.Whatis: Give the real scalar potential on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: AV re {e}
Parameter.Whatis: Give the real vector potential on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: AV re {e} 1
Parameter.Whatis: Give the x-component of the real vector potential on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: AV re {e} 2
Parameter.Whatis: Give the y-component of the real vector potential on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: AV re {e} 3
Parameter.Whatis: Give the z-component of the real vector potential on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: AV im
Parameter.Whatis: Give the imaginary scalar potential on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: AV im {e}
Parameter.Whatis: Give the imaginary vector potential on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: AV im {e} 1
Parameter.Whatis: Give the x-component of the imaginary vector potential on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: AV im {e} 2
Parameter.Whatis: Give the y-component of the imaginary vector potential on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: AV im {e} 3
Parameter.Whatis: Give the z-component of the imaginary vector potential on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: Jfix
Parameter.Whatis: Set the value of the potential field used to make the current divergence free.

Parameter.Name: Dirichlet conditions via magnetic flux density
Magnetic Flux Density 1
Parameter.Whatis: Give the x-component of the desired magnetic flux density.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Flux Density 2
Parameter.Whatis: Give the y-component of the desired magnetic flux density.

Parameter.Whatis: Give the z-component of the desired magnetic flux density.

Parameter.Whatis: Give the nodal component of the desired magnetic flux density.

Parameter.Name: Electric Current Density
Parameter.Whatis: Give the real electric current density on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: Electric Current Density Im
Parameter.Whatis: Give the imaginary electric current density on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: Current Density
Parameter.Whatis: Give the current density on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Strength 1
Parameter.Whatis: Give the real x-component of the desired magnetic field on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Strength 2
Parameter.Whatis: Give the real y-component of the desired magnetic field on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Strength 3
Parameter.Whatis: Give the real z-component of the desired magnetic field on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Strength Im 1
Parameter.Whatis: Give the imaginary x-component of the desired magnetic field on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Strength Im 2
Parameter.Whatis: Give the imaginary y-component of the desired magnetic field on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Strength Im 3
Parameter.Whatis: Give the imaginary z-component of the desired magnetic field on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Transfer Coefficient
Parameter.Whatis: Give the real magnetic transfer coefficient on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Transfer Coefficient Im
Parameter.Whatis: Give the imaginary magnetic transfer coefficient on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: Electric Transfer Coefficient
Parameter.Whatis: Give the real electric transfer coefficient on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: Electric Transfer Coefficient Im
Parameter.Whatis: Give the imaginary electric transfer coefficient on the boundary.

Parameter.Name: Free text
Parameter.Whatis: Free text is copied into the Equation-block of the SIF as such.
Parameter.StatusTip: Free text is copied into the Equation-block of the SIF as such.

Parameter.Name: Calculate Magnetic Field Strength
Parameter.Whatis: Compute the magnetic field strength from the vector potential.

Parameter.Name: Calculate Electric Field
Parameter.Whatis: Compute the electric field from the scalar potential.

Parameter.Name: Calculate Current Density
Parameter.Whatis: Compute the current density from the potential fields.

Parameter.Name: Calculate Maxwell Stress
Parameter.Whatis: Compute the maxwell stress tensor from the potential fields.

Parameter.Name: Calculate Joule Heating
Parameter.Whatis: Compute the heating resulting from the induced currents.

Parameter.Name: Calculate Nodal Forces
Parameter.Whatis: Compute nodal forces to be used as loads in structural analysis.

Parameter.Name: Specify what kind of fields to compute
Skip Elemental Fields
Parameter.Whatis: Skip computation of elemental fields in postprocessing. Appropriate when there are no material discontinuities. Otherwise elemental fields are preferable over nodal ones.

Parameter.Name: Skip Nodal Fields
Parameter.Whatis: Skip computation of nodal fields in postprocessing. This is set True when elemental fields are still computed.

Parameter.Name: Discontinuous Galerkin
Parameter.Whatis: Enforce continuity of solution already at the linear system level using Discontinuous Galerkin method. This is very expensive! Makes nodal fields to be computed elementwise.

Parameter.Name: Discontinuous Bodies
Parameter.Whatis: Enforce continuity of elemental solutions within bodies only. This is done by simple averaging and is therefore a lot cheaper than the Discontinuous Galerkin method.
